title: [Answer] Being Edmund Gunter 2
content:
import math

sin = math.sin
pi = math.pi

for i in range(26):
    x = float(i) / 25.0 * 2 * pi
    character_count_per_line = int((sin(x) + 1) * 15)
    output_str = '#' * character_count_per_line
    print(output_str)

.grader.py.body:
import re
from gradepad import GradePipe, Grader
import cs1robots

counts = [15, 18, 22, 25, 27, 29, 29, 29, 28, 26, 23, 20, 16, 13, 9, 6, 3, 1, 0, 0, 0, 2, 4, 7, 11, 14]

def grade(grader):    
    with open('main.py', 'r') as f:
        main_src = f.read()
        
    test1 = grader.test('The program prints out 26 lines.', 'Please draw a sine curve with 26 lines with max. 30 "#" characters in a line.')
    test2 = grader.test('The program prints out a correctly shaped sine curve.', 'Please draw a sine curve that exactly looks like the one in the expected result section.')
    
    pipe = GradePipe()
    with pipe:
        import main
        
    output_lines = pipe.get_output().split('\n')
    while output_lines and (output_lines[-1] == ''):
        output_lines.pop()
    test1.expect(len(output_lines) == 26)
    for line, count in zip(output_lines, counts):
        test2.expect(line.strip().replace('#', '') == '')
        test2.expect(abs(len(line.strip()) - count) <= 1)
    
grader = Grader(locale='en')
grader.run(grade)
